pullRequest.body:
This PR creates the `Mathlib.Init` file.

This file is intended to be imported by virtually all `Mathlib` files.
This PR also imports `Mathlib.Init` in all `Mathlib` files that import no `Mathlib` file.

In the long run, some very basic files, some tactics and some linters will be imported in `Mathlib.Init`, so that the commands defined there would be available as widely as possible in `Mathlib`.

There is also the file `scripts/init_creation.sh` that contains the instructions to regenerate the `Mathlib/Init.lean` file.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [d02ab0edb9](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15811/commits/d02ab0edb90005f616c7edbdd753d7b874b52bed)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
There are 4655 files with changed transitive imports taking up over 189974 characters: this is too many to display!
You can run `scripts/import_trans_difference.sh all` locally to see the whole output.

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Thanks for starting the process of having a meaningful init file! Separating this into multiple stages makes sense, and this looks like a fine first step to me.
In my mind, the next step is "write a linter that ensure each mathlib file either transitively imports `Mathlib.Init`, or is imported by it. So, I don't quite see why including the script is useful here. (I don't see much harm in keeping it either, and removing it when the above linter is added.)

Let's have another pair of eyes:
maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/db31bad6-1fdb-46ce-80bd-87c3e2e68d47) for commit ba0ef2aaa341f84a0cef1b493ae64cf78f7fb04f.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.
Let's merge matter and try again
#15833 will fix the lint-style failure

Please merge once #15833 has landed.

bors d+

:v: adomani can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Let's wait until there are no performance surprises to merge
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/02da79a3-6053-4df0-ad6d-4f58395e1a64) for commit 903eaa2d70030fb9683f7899366a54d3cd01ae1b.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/2aca54e5-b4e2-47e5-8eba-305881a10779/to/02da79a3-6053-4df0-ad6d-4f58395e1a64) against commit e024d5c04f15a1b917b4063810472b4a1bcab46a.
Thanks! LGTM
Is the omission of the copyright header on `Mathlib.Init` intentional?

> Is the omission of the copyright header on `Mathlib.Init` intentional?

It is, and it also required reviving the copyright linter!  üòÄ
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10406257608/job/28818861862)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10406257608/job/28818862612)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: create Mathlib.Init
